description:
This CME activity focuses on depression in the primary care setting â€“ the screening, assessment, and referral of depressed patients. Guidance is given for effective referral of depressed patients to psychiatry treatment and interfacing with mental health providers and systems. Learners are engaged by didactic videos with animations, short modules with role-play demonstrations of patients and physicians, case studies and self-assessments.

                                            Syllabus
                        IntroductionOverview of Depression in Primary Care SettingsCo-morbidity of Depression and Medical IllnessScreening for and Assessing DepressionDepression and Co-morbidity with Anxiety and Substance AbuseMental Health ReferralsCourse Wrap-upResources and ReferencesHelp!
title: Screening and Assessing Depression in Primary Care Settings: Clinical and Ethical Considerations
